Common interfaces of DE

Core DE

The core data structure of differential evolution is a struct that inherits the abstract type Evolver or, more typically, the DEEvolver, which itself inherits Evolver and represents a single-population DE.

DifferentialEvolution.Evolver — Type
Evolver

Abstract type of all DE core.

source
DifferentialEvolution.Options — Type
Options

Abstract type of all DE options.

source
DifferentialEvolution.DEEvolver — Type
DEEvolver <: Evolver

An abstract normal (single-population) DE evolution type

source
DifferentialEvolution.DEOptions — Type
DEOptions <: Options

Abstract type of options for a DE, particually, a single-population one. See also DEEvolver.

source

Each concrete type of DEEvolver should support the five default interfaces listed below. If the five corresponding fields are defined, then nothing extra needs to be done.

pop(e::DEEvolver) = e.pop
fitness(e::DEEvolver) = e.fitness
senses(e::DEEvolver) = e.senses
bounds(e::DEEvolver) = e.bounds
options(e::DEEvolver) = e.options

Thus, the five fundamental fields listed above can be retrieved directly or using a method with the same name of the field.

DifferentialEvolution.pop — Function
pop(e::DEEvolver)

Get the population of a DE, which is typically a matrix.

source
DifferentialEvolution.fitness — Function
fitness(e::DEEvolver)

Get the fitness of the population, which is generally a vector for single-objective DE or a matrix for multi-objective DE.

source
DifferentialEvolution.senses — Function
senses(e::DEEvolver)

Get the senses of optimization. In traditional evolutionary algorithms, the fitness of an individual is going to be maximized. If minimization is required instead, then set a negative sense.

source
DifferentialEvolution.bounds — Function
bounds(e::DEEvolver)

Get the bound constraints,typically a $n x 2$ matrix for n variables.

source
DifferentialEvolution.options — Function
options(e::DEEvolver)

Get the options of this DE.

source

DE options

Options, i.e., control parameters, of DE are encapsulated in a struct as a subtype of DEOptions (for the most common single-population DE) or a subtype of Options. The options of a given DE is accessed by the method options.

Other utility interfaces

The following three methods have default implementation for DEEvolver.

DifferentialEvolution.nindividuals — Method
nindividuals(e::DEEvolver)

Number of individuals in the population.

source
Base.ndims — Method
ndims(de::DEEvolver)

Number of variables (dimension) of the DE.

source
DifferentialEvolution.nobjectives — Method
nobjectives(e::Evolver)

Number of objectives.

source

No default implementation is provided for the two methods below, since a correct implementation depends on details of the concrete DE type.

DifferentialEvolution.best_individual — Method
best_individual(e::Evolver; all=false)

Get individuals that have the best fitness. If all is true, then all such individuals are returned; otherwise, only one of them is fetched.

source
DifferentialEvolution.best_fitness — Method
best_fitness(e::Evolver)

Get the best fitness among the individuals of the evolver.

source

It is highly recommended that a concrete DE type implements the two best methods as outlined above.

Currently, DifferentialEvolution.jl provides a standard implementation with the types StdDE and StdOptions.
